DataElement.preferredName: PTEN Gene Expression Immunohistochemical Test Assessment Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/unknown indicator to signify whether PTEN expression was assessed by immunohistochemistry.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: PTEN Gene Expression Immunohistochemical Test Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: This gene plays a role in signal transduction and apoptosis. It is also involved in the regulation of cell cycle progression._Typically involves transcription of genetically encoded information into an intermediary message (messenger RNA) and subsequent translation into a functional protein._A diagnostic test in which an antibody is used to link a cellular antigen specifically to a stain that can be seen with a microscope._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: This gene plays a role in signal transduction and apoptosis. It is also involved in the regulation of cell cycle progression.

Concepts.definition: This gene plays a role in signal transduction and apoptosis. It is also involved in the regulation of cell cycle progression.

Property.preferredDefinition: Typically involves transcription of genetically encoded information into an intermediary message (messenger RNA) and subsequent translation into a functional protein.:A diagnostic test in which an antibody is used to link a cellular antigen specifically to a stain that can be seen with a microscope.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: Typically involves transcription of genetically encoded information into an intermediary message (messenger RNA) and subsequent translation into a functional protein.
A diagnostic test in which an antibody is used to link a cellular antigen specifically to a stain that can be seen with a microscope.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
